DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cerebrovascular Accident Or Transient Ischemic Attack Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response that indicates cerebrovascular accidents (strokes) or transient ischemic attacks are part of a patient's personal medical history.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cerebrovascular Accident Or Transient Ischemic Attack Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cerebrovascular Accident Or Transient Ischemic Attack Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of a stroke or transient ischemic attack within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of stroke or intracranial hemorrhage within 6 months prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident including transient ischemic attack (TIA), pulmonary embolism or insufficiently treated deep venous thrombosis (DVT) within the past 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of a stroke or transient ischemic attack within 6 months of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myocardial infarction within past 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of a stroke or transient ischemic attack within 6 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of stroke, reversible ischemic neurological defect or transient ischemic attack within 6 months prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of stroke, transient ischemic attack (TIA), or myocardial infarction, within 6 months prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a stroke (including transient ischemic attack [TIA]), myocardial infarction (MI), or other ischemic event, or thromboembolic event (e.g., deep venous thrombosis [DVT], pulmonary embolism [PE]) within 6 months before first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced prior symptomatic intratumoral or intracranial hemorrhage?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a current or prior symptomatic intratumoral or intracranial hemorrhage?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA) or transient ischemic attack within 12 months prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a vascular or ischemic event within 6 months of study registration?
